thread.title_full: Argyle Capital Maintains Stake in IBM (IBM)

posts.title: Argyle Capital Maintains Stake in IBM (IBM)
posts.text:
Argyle Capital Maintains Stake in IBM (IBM) By Daniel Kobialka | November 30, 2016 — 8:02 AM EST 
Argyle Capital Management maintained its stake in International Business Machines Corp. ( IBM ) in the second quarter of 2016. (See also: Liberty Capital Management Ups Stake in IBM .) 
DailyQuint reported Argyle owned 25,116 shares of IBM worth approximately $3.8 million in 2Q16. Also, Argyle's shares of IBM make up about 1.6 percent of the financial planner's stock portfolio. 
Although Argyle failed to add or subtract IBM shares in 2Q16, other institutional investors modified their stake in the multinational software company, according to DailyQuint. Some of the institutional investors to buy or sell shares of IBM in 2Q16 included: Round Table Services: Boosted its stake by 0.4 percent. Nadler Financial Group: Upped its position in IBM by 0.4 percent. Bremer Trust National Association: Bolstered its position by 0.4 percent. Alpha Windward: Increased its stake in IBM by 1.1 percent. 
IBM shares closed at a price of $164.52 per share on Monday. They feature a 52-week price high of $165.00 per share and a 52-week price low of $116.90 per share. A Closer Look at the Future of IBM 
IBM reported revenue of $81.8 billion last year, and the company looks poised to deliver strong returns to its shareholders in 2016 — and perhaps beyond. 
Ginni Rometty, IBM's CEO, said her company recorded double-digit growth in its strategic initiatives — analytics, cloud, mobility and security — in 3Q16. In addition, IBM Chief Financial Officer Martin Schroeter stated his company returned more than $6 billion to shareholders via dividends and share repurchases during the time frame. 
Overall, IBM generated $19.2 billion in revenue in 3Q16. Schroeter noted IBM's 3Q16 revenue was "relatively flat" year to year, but the company is prioritizing strategic investments that could help the business bolster its earnings both now and in the future. "There's a tremendous amount of change in our industry, and we're continuing to invest where we see the best opportunities. With this, we're addressing new opportunity areas and building new markets, as well as delivering innovation in our existing businesses," he said. thread.title: IBM Named a Leader in Application Programming Interface (API) Management Solutions
thread.title_full: IBM Named a Leader in Application Programming Interface (API) Management Solutions

posts.title: IBM Named a Leader in Application Programming Interface (API) Management Solutions
posts.text:
November 30, 2016 at 12:30 PM EST IBM Named a Leader in Application Programming Interface (API) Management Solutions 
ARMONK, N.Y. , Nov. 30, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- IBM (NYSE: IBM ) announced today that Forrester Research named IBM a leader in its recent report, The Forrester Wave™: API Management Solutions, Q4 2016 . 
Forrester analyzed and scored numerous API management solutions and identified IBM as a "leader" for offering broad and deep functionality. This included creating business agility, adapting to constant change and responding to new and changing competition across a wide range of unpredictable scenarios. 
The 27-criteria evaluation used in the report is designed to help application development and delivery (AD&D) professionals select the right API management platform for their needs. API management platforms were evaluated on current offerings, strategy and market presence. 
The report notes that since Forrester's last Wave evaluation on this space, "IBM has rebuilt its API management solution around its StrongLoop acquisition to create a unified solution for API management and APIs built using Node.js," and "its new microgateway provides a developer-focused extension to API management." 
"Companies are increasingly using APIs to connect new and existing IT services and integrate vast amounts of data as part of their digital transformation strategy and shift to the cloud," said Marie Wieck , general manager, IBM Hybrid Cloud. "We believe this recognition by Forrester underscores IBM's commitment to offer clients innovative hybrid integration solutions for cloud and on-premises deployments to meet their business needs." 
Increasingly, new cloud services depend on integrating data and applications. To allow for this strategic transformation to hybrid cloud environments, IBM offers an easy-to-consume cloud service, IBM API Connect , that developers can use to connect applications, data and microservices. It is designed to make it easier to find, call and connect over the cloud. 
Additionally, IBM API Connect helps enable the automated creation of APIs, simplified discovery of systems of records, self-service access for internal and third party developers and built-in security and governance. 
In addition to a new integration pattern that is further accelerated by the shift to Cloud, APIs may help make it easier to spur on digital transformation, IoT, Mobile and capturing company value and differentiation from existing IT assets. 
IBM helps meet the business needs of its customers by providing a unified solution for API management, that can either be fully vendor-managed, hybrid-vendor managed, or fully customer managed. API Connect is designed to provide value-add functions for platform as a service-based API implementation hosting through IBM Bluemix. Additionally, API Connect forms the basis for IBM's Connect to Cloud family of offerings that enables key IBM software products to expose existing assets to participate in the $2 .2T API economy (source – IBM estimates for 2018). 
About IBM Cloud 
For more information on IBM Cloud visit: www.ibm.com/cloud-computing . 
1. The Forrester Wave™: API Management Solutions, Q4 2016, Forrester Research, Inc., November 14, 2016 .
